detail","metadata_title":"To assess the problem of water resource competition between China, India and Bangladesh in the Brahmaputra River Basin.","metadata_description":"The MacArthur Foundation supports creative people and effective institutions committed to building a more just, verdant, and peaceful world. In addition to selecting the MacArthur Fellows, we work to defend human rights, advance global conservation and security, make cities better places, and understand how technology is affecting children and society.","metadata_keywords":" foundation, philanthropy, grant, grantmaking","custom_s_foundation_id":"106755-0","custom_s_org_id":"43887","custom_s_parent_grantee_id":"","custom_s_grantee_location":"Arlington, Virginia","custom_s_grant_approved_date":"2014-10-14T00:00:00","custom_s_name":"CNA","custom_t_name":"CNA","custom_s_city":"Arlington","custom_s_state":"VA","custom_s_state_display":"Virginia","custom_s_country":"US","custom_s_country_display":"United States","custom_s_amount":"300000.0","custom_s_amount_display":"$300,000","custom_s_title":"To assess the problem of water resource competition between China, India and Bangladesh in the Brahmaputra River Basin.","custom_s_description":"The CNA Corporation is a non-profit research organization that operates the Center for Naval Analyses and the Institute for Public Research. This project will examine the security implications of water scarcity in the Brahmaputra river basin in China, India and Bangladesh, with the objective of informing dimensions of larger Sino-Indian bilateral ties. Using qualitative and quantitative methods, it will analyze political relations among the three countries, apply lessons learned from existing water-security gaming exercises conducted by CNA, and utilize findings from facilitated roundtables in Bangladesh, China and India to suggest possible solutions to water scarcity issues and political tensions among the three states.","custom_t_title":"To assess the problem of water resource competition between China, India and Bangladesh in the Brahmaputra River Basin.","custom_t_description":"The CNA Corporation is a non-profit research organization that operates the Center for Naval Analyses and the Institute for Public Research. This project will examine the security implications of water scarcity in the Brahmaputra river basin in China, India and Bangladesh, with the objective of informing dimensions of larger Sino-Indian bilateral ties. Using qualitative and quantitative methods, it will analyze political relations among the three countries, apply lessons learned from existing water-security gaming exercises conducted by CNA, and utilize findings from facilitated roundtables in Bangladesh, China and India to suggest possible solutions to water scarcity issues and political tensions among the three states.","custom_s_year_approved":"2014","custom_i_year_approved":2014,"custom_s_start_date":"2015-03-01T12:00:00+00:00","custom_s_end_date":"2016-08-31T12:00:00","custom_s_program_area_code":"IPS","custom_s_level_1_sub_category":"ASI","custom_s_level_2_sub_category":"ASI","custom_s_is_subgrant":"false","custom_s_is_projectgrant":"false","custom_s_is_representative":"false","custom_s_term_in_months":"1 year 6 months","custom_s_grantee_url":"/grantee/cna-43887/","custom_ss_topic_id":["101145"],"custom_s_amountrange":"2","custom_i_page_score":0,"title":"To assess the problem of water resource competition between China, India and Bangladesh in the Brahmaputra River Basin.","custom_s_url":"www.cna.org","content":"","custom_s_boost_keywords":"","custom_t_boost_keywords":"","custom_s_key_image":"","custom_dt_date":"2021-01-02T19:47:58Z","language":"en","content_en":"","_version_":1744515734815375360},{"id":"200846","url":"200846","custom_s_template":"grant detail","metadata_title":"to produce a series of case studies documenting the experience of jurisdictions participating in the Safety and Justice Challenge during its first five years.","metadata_description":"The MacArthur Foundation supports creative people and effective institutions committed to building a more just, verdant, and peaceful world. In addition to selecting the MacArthur Fellows, we work to defend human rights, advance global conservation and security, make cities better places, and understand how technology is affecting children and society.","metadata_keywords":" foundation, philanthropy, grant, grantmaking","custom_s_foundation_id":"2004-154624","custom_s_org_id":"23","custom_s_parent_grantee_id":"","custom_s_grantee_location":"Washington, D.C.","custom_s_grant_approved_date":"2020-12-15T00:00:00","custom_s_name":"Urban Institute","custom_t_name":"Urban Institute","custom_s_city":"Washington","custom_s_state":"DC","custom_s_state_display":"District of Columbia","custom_s_country":"US","custom_s_country_display":"United States","custom_s_amount":"600000.0","custom_s_amount_display":"$600,000","custom_s_title":"to produce a series of case studies documenting the experience of jurisdictions participating in the Safety and Justice Challenge during its first five years.","custom_s_description":"<p>Established in 1968, the Urban Institute (Urban) conducts economic and social policy research and evaluation to understand and solve real-world challenges in a rapidly urbanizing environment. This award enables Urban to produce a series of case studies documenting the experience of jurisdictions participating in the Safety and Justice Challenge during its first five years, with the broad aim of furthering the field’s understanding of how reductions in jail usage have been realized to date. All studies will have both qualitative and quantitative components, and will be designed to spread what has been learned and achieved as widely as possible, in order to generate national momentum for local criminal justice reform.</p>","custom_t_title":"to produce a series of case studies documenting the experience of jurisdictions participating in the Safety and Justice Challenge during its first five years.","custom_t_description":"<p>Established in 1968, the Urban Institute (Urban) conducts economic and social policy research and evaluation to understand and solve real-world challenges in a rapidly urbanizing environment. This award enables Urban to produce a series of case studies documenting the experience of jurisdictions participating in the Safety and Justice Challenge during its first five years, with the broad aim of furthering the field’s understanding of how reductions in jail usage have been realized to date. All studies will have both qualitative and quantitative components, and will be designed to spread what has been learned and achieved as widely as possible, in order to generate national momentum for local criminal justice reform.</p>","custom_s_year_approved":"2020","custom_i_year_approved":2020,"custom_s_start_date":"2021-01-01T12:00:00+00:00","custom_s_end_date":"2022-12-31T12:00:00","custom_s_program_area_code":"CJ","custom_s_level_1_sub_category":"RSC","custom_s_level_2_sub_category":"RSC","custom_s_is_subgrant":"false","custom_s_is_projectgrant":"false","custom_s_is_representative":"","custom_s_term_in_months":"2 years","custom_s_grantee_url":"/grantee/urban-institute-23/","custom_s_program_id":"102194","custom_s_program_name":"Criminal Justice","custom_ss_topic_id":["101127"],"custom_s_amountrange":"3","custom_i_page_score":0,"title":"to produce a series of case studies documenting the experience of jurisdictions participating in the Safety and Justice Challenge during its first five years.","custom_s_url":"www.urban.org","content":"","custom_s_boost_keywords":"","custom_t_boost_keywords":"","custom_s_key_image":"","custom_dt_date":"2021-05-04T14:36:39Z","language":"en","content_en":"","_version_":1744790712175558656},{"id":"84838","url":"84838","custom_s_template":"grant detail","metadata_title":"To research barriers to women becoming secondary school teachers and to develop strategies to address these barriers in Uganda and Tanzania (over three years).","metadata_description":"The MacArthur Foundation supports creative people and effective institutions committed to building a more just, verdant, and peaceful world. In addition to selecting the MacArthur Fellows, we work to defend human rights, advance global conservation and security, make cities better places, and understand how technology is affecting children and society.","metadata_keywords":" foundation, philanthropy, grant, grantmaking","custom_s_foundation_id":"99535-0","custom_s_org_id":"44272","custom_s_parent_grantee_id":"","custom_s_grantee_location":"Adelphi, Maryland","custom_s_grant_approved_date":"2011-12-13T00:00:00","custom_s_name":"University of Maryland, College Park, College of Education, International Education Policy Program","custom_t_name":"University of Maryland, College Park, College of Education, International Education Policy Program","custom_s_city":"Adelphi","custom_s_state":"MD","custom_s_state_display":"Maryland","custom_s_country":"US","custom_s_country_display":"United States","custom_s_amount":"350000.0","custom_s_amount_display":"$350,000","custom_s_title":"To research barriers to women becoming secondary school teachers and to develop strategies to address these barriers in Uganda and Tanzania (over three years).","custom_s_description":"University of Maryland will conduct a policy-oriented research study on the barriers to women becoming secondary school teachers in three African countries and what can be done to overcome those barriers.  MacArthur is supporting two of the case studies (in Uganda and Tanzania). The project will use quantitative data gathered from Ministries of Education and other sources, as well as qualitative data gathered from semi-structured interviews with Ministry of Education officials, teachers, and other actors. U of Maryland will work with the Forum for African Women Educationalists (FAWE) and the respective Ministries of Education to create and implement an “Action Plan to Overcome Gender Imbalance in the Teaching Force.”","custom_t_title":"To research barriers to women becoming secondary school teachers and to develop strategies to address these barriers in Uganda and Tanzania (over three years).","custom_t_description":"University of Maryland will conduct a policy-oriented research study on the barriers to women becoming secondary school teachers in three African countries and what can be done to overcome those barriers.  MacArthur is supporting two of the case studies (in Uganda and Tanzania). The project will use quantitative data gathered from Ministries of Education and other sources, as well as qualitative data gathered from semi-structured interviews with Ministry of Education officials, teachers, and other actors. U of Maryland will work with the Forum for African Women Educationalists (FAWE) and the respective Ministries of Education to create and implement an “Action Plan to Overcome Gender Imbalance in the Teaching Force.”","custom_s_year_approved":"2011","custom_i_year_approved":2011,"custom_s_start_date":"2012-01-01T12:00:00+00:00","custom_s_end_date":"2015-12-31T12:00:00","custom_s_program_area_code":"GSE","custom_s_level_1_sub_category":"COU","custom_s_level_2_sub_category":"COU","custom_s_is_subgrant":"false","custom_s_is_projectgrant":"false","custom_s_is_representative":"false","custom_s_term_in_months":"4 years","custom_s_grantee_url":"/grantee/university-of-maryland-college-park-college-of-education-international-education-policy-program-44272/","custom_s_program_id":"102134","custom_s_program_name":"Girls' Secondary Education in Developing Countries","custom_ss_topic_id":["101131"],"custom_s_amountrange":"2","custom_i_page_score":0,"title":"To research barriers to women becoming secondary school teachers and to develop strategies to address these barriers in Uganda and Tanzania (over three years).","custom_s_url":"www.usmf.org","content":"","custom_s_boost_keywords":"","custom_t_boost_keywords":"","custom_s_key_image":"","custom_dt_date":"2021-01-02T19:45:19Z","language":"en","content_en":"","_version_":1745866502150553600},{"id":"182374","url":"182374","custom_s_template":"grant detail","metadata_title":"in support of the Documentary Community Board.","metadata_description":"The MacArthur Foundation supports creative people and effective institutions committed to building a more just, verdant, and peaceful world. In addition to selecting the MacArthur Fellows, we work to defend human rights, advance global conservation and security, make cities better places, and understand how technology is affecting children and society.","metadata_keywords":" foundation, philanthropy, grant, grantmaking","custom_s_foundation_id":"2007-154806","custom_s_org_id":"10115307","custom_s_parent_grantee_id":"","custom_s_grantee_location":"Miami, Florida","custom_s_grant_approved_date":"2020-10-29T00:00:00","custom_s_name":"Community Board","custom_t_name":"Community Board","custom_s_city":"Miami","custom_s_state":"FL","custom_s_state_display":"Florida","custom_s_country":"US","custom_s_country_display":"United States","custom_s_amount":"25000.0","custom_s_amount_display":"$25,000","custom_s_title":"in support of the Documentary Community Board.","custom_s_description":"<p>The Community Board, LLC is the home of the Documentary Community Board (the Board), a new independent coalition that will establish a representative body of Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC) filmmakers, impact producers, and film professionals engaged in culture shift and advocacy efforts within the documentary film field. This award supports the Board’s initial phase: mapping of current efforts and pursuing cross-community initiatives; identifying opportunities to advocate on behalf of filmmakers of color whom have experienced harassment within the field; informing solutions for equity and accountability by curating qualitative and quantitative data that reinforces the contributions of BIPOC filmmakers; and providing feedback on institutional accountability processes that mitigate the risk of emotional harm and career damage due to individual self-advocacy. The intended outcomes of this grant are mapping the current culture shift interventions across the industry, developing an entity that collectively intervenes on behalf of filmmakers of color and engages in institutional accountability efforts.</p>","custom_t_title":"in support of the Documentary Community Board.","custom_t_description":"<p>The Community Board, LLC is the home of the Documentary Community Board (the Board), a new independent coalition that will establish a representative body of Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC) filmmakers, impact producers, and film professionals engaged in culture shift and advocacy efforts within the documentary film field. This award supports the Board’s initial phase: mapping of current efforts and pursuing cross-community initiatives; identifying opportunities to advocate on behalf of filmmakers of color whom have experienced harassment within the field; informing solutions for equity and accountability by curating qualitative and quantitative data that reinforces the contributions of BIPOC filmmakers; and providing feedback on institutional accountability processes that mitigate the risk of emotional harm and career damage due to individual self-advocacy. The intended outcomes of this grant are mapping the current culture shift interventions across the industry, developing an entity that collectively intervenes on behalf of filmmakers of color and engages in institutional accountability efforts.</p>","custom_s_year_approved":"2020","custom_i_year_approved":2020,"custom_s_start_date":"2020-09-01T12:00:00+00:00","custom_s_end_date":"2021-07-31T12:00:00","custom_s_program_area_code":"JOU","custom_s_level_1_sub_category":"NFM","custom_s_level_2_sub_category":"NFM","custom_s_is_subgrant":"false","custom_s_is_projectgrant":"false","custom_s_is_representative":"","custom_s_term_in_months":" 11 months","custom_s_grantee_url":"/grantee/community-board-10115307/","custom_s_program_id":"102192","custom_s_program_name":"Journalism & Media","custom_ss_topic_id":["101134"],"custom_s_amountrange":"1","custom_i_page_score":0,"title":"in support of the Documentary Community Board.","custom_s_url":"","content":"","custom_s_boost_keywords":"","custom_t_boost_keywords":"","custom_s_key_image":"","custom_dt_date":"2021-01-02T19:48:53Z","language":"en","content_en":"","_version_":1744515751657603072},{"id":"79733","url":"79733","custom_s_template":"grant detail","metadata_title":"to support the development of a Strategic Roadmap to Reduce Nuclear Threat.","metadata_description":"The MacArthur Foundation supports creative people and effective institutions committed to building a more just, verdant, and peaceful world. In addition to selecting the MacArthur Fellows, we work to defend human rights, advance global conservation and security, make cities better places, and understand how technology is affecting children and society.","metadata_keywords":" foundation, philanthropy, grant, grantmaking","custom_s_foundation_id":"1702-151616","custom_s_org_id":"10114429","custom_s_parent_grantee_id":"","custom_s_grantee_location":"New York, New York","custom_s_grant_approved_date":"2017-05-06T00:00:00","custom_s_name":"Nucleus Impact","custom_t_name":"Nucleus Impact","custom_s_city":"New York","custom_s_state":"NY","custom_s_state_display":"New York","custom_s_country":"US","custom_s_country_display":"United States","custom_s_amount":"150000.0","custom_s_amount_display":"$150,000","custom_s_title":"to support the development of a Strategic Roadmap to Reduce Nuclear Threat.","custom_s_description":"Populist is a non-profit organization that brings together world-class marketers and social innovators. This award provides support for the second phase of its work, partnering with marketing company, Nucleus Branding, on catalyzing conversation and motivating engagement on nuclear policy issues. The first phase drew on qualitative research to empower the nuclear risk reduction community with new ways to speak effectively and persuasively with influencers; the second phase identifies specifically what to message and to whom. To do this Populist designs, fields, and analyzes a quantitative research study (providing statistically significant and projectable results). The ultimate output is a strategic roadmap that organizations in the field can use to communicate more effectively.","custom_t_title":"to support the development of a Strategic Roadmap to Reduce Nuclear Threat.","custom_t_description":"Populist is a non-profit organization that brings together world-class marketers and social innovators. The first phase drew on qualitative research to empower the nuclear risk reduction community with new ways to speak effectively and persuasively with influencers; the second phase identifies specifically what to message and to whom. To do this Populist designs, fields, and analyzes a quantitative research study (providing statistically significant and projectable results). The ultimate output is a strategic roadmap that organizations in the field can use to communicate more effectively.","custom_s_year_approved":"2017","custom_i_year_approved":2017,"custom_s_start_date":"2017-06-01T12:00:00+00:00","custom_s_end_date":"2019-04-30T12:00:00","custom_s_program_area_code":"NCP","custom_s_level_1_sub_category":"SIT","custom_s_level_2_sub_category":"SIT","custom_s_is_subgrant":"false","custom_s_is_projectgrant":"false","custom_s_is_representative":"false","custom_s_term_in_months":"1 year 11 months","custom_s_grantee_url":"/grantee/nucleus-impact-10114429/","custom_s_program_id":"102178","custom_s_program_name":"Nuclear Challenges","custom_ss_topic_id":["101145"],"custom_s_amountrange":"2","custom_i_page_score":0,"title":"to support the development of a Strategic Roadmap to Reduce Nuclear Threat.","custom_s_url":"","content":"","custom_s_boost_keywords":"","custom_t_boost_keywords":"","custom_s_key_image":"","custom_dt_date":"2021-01-02T20:00:51Z","language":"en","content_en":"","_version_":1744692609276706816},{"id":"86580","url":"86580","custom_s_template":"grant detail","metadata_title":"To assess East Asian defense spending and U.S. policy and grand strategy in East Asia (over three years).","metadata_description":"The MacArthur Foundation supports creative people and effective institutions committed to building a more just, verdant, and peaceful world. In addition to selecting the MacArthur Fellows, we work to defend human rights, advance global conservation and security, make cities better places, and understand how technology is affecting children and society.","metadata_keywords":" foundation, philanthropy, grant, grantmaking","custom_s_foundation_id":"107229-0","custom_s_org_id":"1773","custom_s_parent_grantee_id":"","custom_s_grantee_location":"Los Angeles, California","custom_s_grant_approved_date":"2014-10-14T00:00:00","custom_s_name":"University of Southern California","custom_t_name":"University of Southern California","custom_s_city":"Los Angeles","custom_s_state":"CA","custom_s_state_display":"California","custom_s_country":"US","custom_s_country_display":"United States","custom_s_amount":"350000.0","custom_s_amount_display":"$350,000","custom_s_title":"To assess East Asian defense spending and U.S. policy and grand strategy in East Asia (over three years).","custom_s_description":"Founded in 1880, the University of Southern California is a private research institution enrolling more international students than any other U.S. university. This study addresses U.S. policy and grand strategy in East Asia by combining an empirical examination of East Asian defense spending with research on weapons procurement and security policy. Despite the emerging consensus that East Asian nations fear China’s rise, regional military expenditures are at a 25-year low when measured as a proportion of GDP. Through quantitative and qualitative research, structured interviews and workshops, this project examines whether low defense expenditures accurately reflect East Asian states’ security perceptions, and the extent to which defense spending might indicate sheltering under the U.S. security umbrella.","custom_t_title":"To assess East Asian defense spending and U.S. policy and grand strategy in East Asia (over three years).","custom_t_description":"Founded in 1880, the University of Southern California is a private research institution enrolling more international students than any other U.S. university. This study addresses U.S. policy and grand strategy in East Asia by combining an empirical examination of East Asian defense spending with research on weapons procurement and security policy. Despite the emerging consensus that East Asian nations fear China’s rise, regional military expenditures are at a 25-year low when measured as a proportion of GDP. Through quantitative and qualitative research, structured interviews and workshops, this project examines whether low defense expenditures accurately reflect East Asian states’ security perceptions, and the extent to which defense spending might indicate sheltering under the U.S. security umbrella.","custom_s_year_approved":"2014","custom_i_year_approved":2014,"custom_s_start_date":"2015-01-01T12:00:00+00:00","custom_s_end_date":"2017-12-31T12:00:00","custom_s_program_area_code":"IPS","custom_s_level_1_sub_category":"ASI","custom_s_level_2_sub_category":"ASI","custom_s_is_subgrant":"false","custom_s_is_projectgrant":"false","custom_s_is_representative":"false","custom_s_term_in_months":"3 years","custom_s_grantee_url":"/grantee/university-of-southern-california-1773/","custom_ss_topic_id":["101145"],"custom_s_amountrange":"2","custom_i_page_score":0,"title":"To assess East Asian defense spending and U.S. policy and grand strategy in East Asia (over three years).","custom_s_url":"www.usc.edu","content":"","custom_s_boost_keywords":"","custom_t_boost_keywords":"","custom_s_key_image":"","custom_dt_date":"2021-01-02T19:47:59Z","language":"en","content_en":"","_version_":1745864275708084224},{"id":"77683","url":"77683","custom_s_template":"grant detail","metadata_title":"to support the T100 project, a longitudinal study that will gather previously unavailable data and yield insights on the preferences and behaviors of a group of investors providing catalytic capital.","metadata_description":"The MacArthur Foundation supports creative people and effective institutions committed to building a more just, verdant, and peaceful world. In addition to selecting the MacArthur Fellows, we work to defend human rights, advance global conservation and security, make cities better places, and understand how technology is affecting children and society.","metadata_keywords":" foundation, philanthropy, grant, grantmaking","custom_s_foundation_id":"1808-153507","custom_s_org_id":"10114507","custom_s_parent_grantee_id":"","custom_s_grantee_location":"San Francisco, California","custom_s_grant_approved_date":"2018-11-03T00:00:00","custom_s_name":"Toniic","custom_t_name":"Toniic","custom_s_city":"San Francisco","custom_s_state":"CA","custom_s_state_display":"California","custom_s_country":"US","custom_s_country_display":"United States","custom_s_amount":"170000.0","custom_s_amount_display":"$170,000","custom_s_title":"to support the T100 project, a longitudinal study that will gather previously unavailable data and yield insights on the preferences and behaviors of a group of investors providing catalytic capital.","custom_s_description":"<p>Toniic is a leading impact investing network serving individuals, family offices, foundations and funds that seeks to increase the flow of impact-oriented capital and services to address global challenges, including an emerging interest in the development of an investment framework for the sustainable development goals (SDGs). Toniic believes that one of the primary reasons investors stay on the sidelines is the lack of compelling quantitative and qualitative data points and case studies that both illustrate the viability of impact investing and demonstrate the business case for the development of impact investing products and services. Researchers lack data-sets to assess questions like how impact risk and impact return is related to financial risk and financial return. The proposed grant contributes to addressing these issues through support for the T100 project – a longitudinal study of the investing experience of Toniic’s 100% Impact Network members using impact portfolio tools, directories, case studies and reports. This project is well-positioned to yield widely accessible longitudinal data on the preferences and behaviors of a group of investors, many of whom are providing catalytic capital.</p>","custom_t_title":"to support the T100 project, a longitudinal study that will gather previously unavailable data and yield insights on the preferences and behaviors of a group of investors providing catalytic capital.","custom_t_description":"<p>Toniic is a leading impact investing network serving individuals, family offices, foundations and funds that seeks to increase the flow of impact-oriented capital and services to address global challenges, including an emerging interest in the development of an investment framework for the sustainable development goals (SDGs). Toniic believes that one of the primary reasons investors stay on the sidelines is the lack of compelling quantitative and qualitative data points and case studies that both illustrate the viability of impact investing and demonstrate the business case for the development of impact investing products and services. Researchers lack data-sets to assess questions like how impact risk and impact return is related to financial risk and financial return. The proposed grant contributes to addressing these issues through support for the T100 project – a longitudinal study of the investing experience of Toniic’s 100% Impact Network members using impact portfolio tools, directories, case studies and reports. This project is well-positioned to yield widely accessible longitudinal data on the preferences and behaviors of a group of investors, many of whom are providing catalytic capital.</p>","custom_s_year_approved":"2018","custom_i_year_approved":2018,"custom_s_start_date":"2019-01-01T12:00:00+00:00","custom_s_end_date":"2019-12-31T12:00:00","custom_s_program_area_code":"II","custom_s_level_1_sub_category":"GRT","custom_s_level_2_sub_category":"GRT","custom_s_is_subgrant":"false","custom_s_is_projectgrant":"false","custom_s_is_representative":"false","custom_s_term_in_months":"1 year","custom_s_grantee_url":"/grantee/toniic-10114507/","custom_s_program_id":"102206","custom_s_program_name":"Impact Investments","custom_s_amountrange":"2","custom_i_page_score":0,"title":"to support the T100 project, a longitudinal study that will gather previously unavailable data and yield insights on the preferences and behaviors of a group of investors providing catalytic capital.","custom_s_url":"","content":"","custom_s_boost_keywords":"","custom_t_boost_keywords":"","custom_s_key_image":"","custom_dt_date":"2021-01-02T19:46:48Z","language":"en","content_en":"","_version_":1744688894362779648},{"id":"101124","url":"101124","custom_s_template":"grant detail","metadata_title":"to raise awareness about the importance of intact forests in Canada and catalyze actions that support intact forest protection.","metadata_description":"The MacArthur Foundation supports creative people and effective institutions committed to building a more just, verdant, and peaceful world. In addition to selecting the MacArthur Fellows, we work to defend human rights, advance global conservation and security, make cities better places, and understand how technology is affecting children and society.","metadata_keywords":" foundation, philanthropy, grant, grantmaking","custom_s_foundation_id":"1609-151287","custom_s_org_id":"16133","custom_s_parent_grantee_id":"","custom_s_grantee_location":"Washington, D.C.","custom_s_grant_approved_date":"2016-12-12T00:00:00","custom_s_name":"Greenpeace","custom_t_name":"Greenpeace","custom_s_city":"Washington","custom_s_state":"DC","custom_s_state_display":"District of Columbia","custom_s_country":"US","custom_s_country_display":"United States","custom_s_amount":"400000.0","custom_s_amount_display":"$400,000","custom_s_title":"to raise awareness about the importance of intact forests in Canada and catalyze actions that support intact forest protection.","custom_s_description":"Greenpeace is an independent campaigning organization, dedicated to ensuring the ability of the earth to nurture life in all its diversity. The purpose of the project is to understand whether and how political will for intact forest conservation can be shaped in Canada, the country with the third largest area of intact forest landscapes on the planet. Greenpeace is designing and implementing a sophisticated communications program with the aim to establish the pan-boreal region, the Great Northern Forest, as one of the planet’s most iconic forests, and expand the Canadian and First Nation constituencies that favor greater forest protection. The intended outcome is a shift in public perception and action in support of intact forests. Greenpeace's market research is inteded to establish a baseline of perceptions and shape a campaign with messaging activities that include social media, films, artwork, and education. At the end of the two-year project, the same market research partner will conduct a follow up assessment to identify statistically significant shifts in public perception of intact forests and collect qualitative information around the impact of the campaign.","custom_t_title":"to raise awareness about the importance of intact forests in Canada and catalyze actions that support intact forest protection.","custom_t_description":"Greenpeace is an independent campaigning organization, dedicated to ensuring the ability of the earth to nurture life in all its diversity. The purpose of the project is to understand whether and how political will for intact forest conservation can be shaped in Canada, the country with the third largest area of intact forest landscapes on the planet. Greenpeace is designing and implementing a sophisticated communications program with the aim to establish the pan-boreal region, the Great Northern Forest, as one of the planet’s most iconic forests, and expand the Canadian and First Nation constituencies that favor greater forest protection. The intended outcome is a shift in public perception and action in support of intact forests. Greenpeace's market research is inteded to establish a baseline of perceptions and shape a campaign with messaging activities that include social media, films, artwork, and education. At the end of the two-year project, the same market research partner will conduct a follow up assessment to identify statistically significant shifts in public perception of intact forests and collect qualitative information around the impact of the campaign.","custom_s_year_approved":"2016","custom_i_year_approved":2016,"custom_s_start_date":"2016-12-01T12:00:00+00:00","custom_s_end_date":"2018-11-30T12:00:00","custom_s_program_area_code":"CSD","custom_s_level_1_sub_category":"INTF","custom_s_level_2_sub_category":"INTF","custom_s_is_subgrant":"false","custom_s_is_projectgrant":"false","custom_s_is_representative":"false","custom_s_term_in_months":"2 years","custom_s_grantee_url":"/grantee/greenpeace-16133/","custom_s_program_id":"102144","custom_s_program_name":"Conservation & Sustainable Development","custom_ss_topic_id":["101136"],"custom_s_amountrange":"2","custom_i_page_score":0,"title":"to raise awareness about the importance of intact forests in Canada and catalyze actions that support intact forest protection.","custom_s_url":"www.greenpeace.org","content":"","custom_s_boost_keywords":"","custom_t_boost_keywords":"","custom_s_key_image":"","custom_dt_date":"2021-01-02T20:00:18Z","language":"en","content_en":"","_version_":1744797666660843520}]}}
